Key Arguments: The proposed legislation is compared to living under a regime like North Korea, implying it would lead to excessive censorship.
The laws are seen as incompatible with an open and free society.
The submission suggests that the Australian public would not support such laws and that they were not democratically voted on.
There is a concern that such laws would prevent the populace from defending itself against government misinformation.
Notable Quotes: Living in Australia will become comparable to living in a Soft Core North Korea with these laws.
These censorship proposals are not compatible with an open and free society.
Australia would vote no to such laws guaranteed.
How can a populace defend itself against a government lying to its own people with laws like this in force?
